title: Camshaft Cover - Removal (with secondary air injection)

body.body: Camshaft Cover - Removal (with secondary air injection)
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Battery Disconnect DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DVY; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Fuel Tank Removal DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DVB; DWB; DX4; DW4; DVY; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Remove the upper coolant tube fixing and re-position the coolant filler neck to allow clearance between the camshaft cover and the coolant filler cap.
Remove the secondary air injection solenoid (see
Secondary Air Injection Solenoid - Removal (if fitted)
Remove the secondary air injection reed valves (see
Secondary Air Injection Reed Valves - Removal (if fitted)
Progressively release the camshaft cover fixings.
Raise the camshaft cover and manoeuvre it towards the right hand side of the engine, where it can be removed.
Never use a lever to remove the camshaft cover from the cylinder head.
Using a lever will cause damage to the cylinder head and camshaft cover, which could lead to an oil leak.
Discard the camshaft cover gasket and rubber seals.
Remove any residual oil from the mating face of the cylinder head using a lint free cloth.

search: Camshaft Cover - Removal (with secondary air injection)
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Perform the following operations:
Disconnect the battery (see
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Ignition Coils - Removal
Remove the upper coolant tube fixing and re-position the coolant filler neck to allow clearance between the camshaft cover and the coolant filler cap.
Fixing
Upper coolant tube
Remove the secondary air injection solenoid (see
Secondary Air Injection Solenoid - Removal (if fitted)
Remove the secondary air injection reed valves (see
Secondary Air Injection Reed Valves - Removal (if fitted)
Remove the spark plugs.
Progressively release the camshaft cover fixings.
Raise the camshaft cover and manoeuvre it towards the right hand side of the engine, where it can be removed.
Never use a lever to remove the camshaft cover from the cylinder head.
Using a lever will cause damage to the cylinder head and camshaft cover, which could lead to an oil leak.
Remove the camshaft cover gasket.
Discard the camshaft cover gasket and rubber seals.
Remove any residual oil from the mating face of the cylinder head using a lint free cloth.
